IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO PROVIDE ACCESS TO INFORMATION AND SERVICES TO EMPOWER ADULTS TO LIVE WITH DIGNITY.
IRS990.MissionDesc: TO PROVIDE ACCESS TO INFORMATION AND SERVICES TO EMPOWER ADULTS TO LIVE WITH DIGNITY.
IRS990.Desc: NUTRITION GRANT - FUNDING IS AWARDED TO THREE COMMUNITY-BASED ORGANIZATIONS TO DELIVER NUTRITIONALLY SOUND MEALS TO CONGREGATE SITES AND HOME-BOUND INDIVIDUALS. IN ADDITION, NUTRITION EDUCATION AND COUNSELING SERVICES ARE AVAILABLE. DURING FY18 APPROXIMATELY 276,844 MEALS WERE DELIVERED TO 1,385 PEOPLE IN THEIR HOMES AND 88,466 MEALS WERE SERVED TO 3,073 PEOPLE AT THE COMMUNITY CAFES. STATE AND FEDERAL FUNDS COVER A PORTION OF THE TOTAL COST OF THE MEALS LEAVING THE ORGANIZATIONS TO RAISE THE BALANCE OF THEIR BUDGETS THROUGH FUNDRAISING EFFORTS AND OTHER LOCAL SUPPORT.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: SOCIAL SERVICE GRANT - FUNDING IS AWARDED TO 18 COMMUNITY-BASED ORGANIZATIONS TO PROVIDE A COMPREHENSIVE MENU OF LONG-TERM SUPPORTS AND SERVICES TO PEOPLE 60+ YEARS OF AGE. SERVICES INCLUDE, BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO, TRANSPORTATION, HEALTH SCREENINGS, ADULT DAY CARE, HOMEMAKERS, HOME HEALTH AIDES, DENTAL SERVICES AND LEGAL ASSISTANCE. DURING FY18 APPROXIMATELY 1,537 INDIVIDUALS WERE PROVIDED LONG-TERM SUPPORTS AND SERVICES UNDER 23 CONTRACTS PROVIDING OVER 52,679 UNITS OF SERVICE.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: THE NATIONAL FAMILY CAREGIVERS PROGRAM ASSISTS CAREGIVERS WITH THE CARE THEY PROVIDE FOR OTHERS. THE PROGRAM SUPPORTS CAREGIVERS WITH RESPITE CARE, CASE MANAGEMENT, TRAINING, EDUCATION, AND SUPPLEMENTAL SERVICES. IN FY18, 315 CAREGIVERS RECEIVED 29,613 UNITS OF SERVICE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ONGOING MONITORING ACTIVITIES MAY INCLUDE ANY (OR ALL) OF THE FOLLOWING DEPENDING ON THE SUB-RECIPIENT: A) REGULAR CONTACTS WITH SUB-RECIPIENTS AND APPROPRIATE INQUIRIES REGARDING THE PROGRAM B) REVIEWING PROGRAMMATIC AND FINANCIAL REPORTS PREPARED AND SUBMITTED BY THE SUB-RECIPIENT AND FOLLOWING UP ON AREAS OF CONCERN C) MONITORING SUB-RECIPIENT BUDGETS D) PERFORMING SITE VISITS TO THE SUB-RECIPIENT TO REVIEW FINANCIAL AND PROGRAMMATIC RECORDS AND ASSESS COMPLIANCE WITH APPLICABLE LAWS, REGULATIONS, AND PROVISIONS OF THE SUB-AWARD E) OFFERING SUB-RECIPIENTS TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE WHERE NEEDED F) MAINTAINING A SYSTEM TO TRACK AND FOLLOW UP ON DEFICIENCIES NOTED AT THE SUB-RECIPIENT IN ORDER TO ASSURE THAT APPROPRIATE CORRECTIVE ACTION IS TAKEN G) ESTABLISHING AND MAINTAINING A TRACKING SYSTEM TO ASSURE TIMELY SUBMISSION OF ALL REPORTS REQUIRED OF THE SUB-RECIPIENT

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FORM 990 IS REVIEWED AT THE BOARD MEETING BEFORE FILING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: BOARD MEMBERS WITH A CONFLICT OF INTEREST OF OFFICERS OF PRIVATE AGENCIES OR OTHER COMMUNITY AGENCIES OR GOVERNMENTAL BODIES MAY SERVE ON THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS, BUT MAY NOT VOTE, PARTICIPATE IN BOARD DISCUSSIONS, BE PRESENT AT OR IN ANY WAY INFLUENCE THE BOARD DISCUSSION AND DECISIONS RELATING TO ANY AGENCY OR BODY OF WHICH THEY ARE MEMBERS. BOARD MEMBERS SHALL SIGN A BI-ANNUAL DECLARATORY STATEMENT WHICH DISCLOSES ALL OTHER BOARDS AND COMMISSIONS ON WHICH THEY MAY CURRENTLY SERVE, AND DECLARE THEIR INTENT TO AVOID PARTICIPATION IN, DISCUSSION OF, OR IN ANY WAY INFLUENCE THE VOTE ON ANY ISSUE AFFECTING ONE OF THOSE BOARDS OR COMMISSIONS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ALL BOARD MEMBERS ARE ASKED TO COMPLETE INDIVIDUAL EVALUATION FORMS REVIEWING THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR. EVALUATIONS ARE SUBMITTED TO THE PERSONNEL COMMITTEE. THEIR RESULTS ARE FORWARDED TO THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE, THEN TO THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. COMPENSATION IS COMPARED TO SIMILAR POSITIONS AND IS SET BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: SUBCONTRACTING PROGRAM SERVICE EXPENSES: PROGRAM SERVICE EXPENSES 723,410. MANAGEMENT AND GENERAL EXPENSES 10,190. FUNDRAISING EXPENSES 0. TOTAL EXPENSES 733,600.
